H0.text: Which  constellation contains many bright shining stars, such as Regulus. Orion

H1.text: Which  constellation contains many bright shining stars, such as Regulus. Scorpius

H2.text: Which  constellation contains many bright shining stars, such as Regulus. Canis Major

H3.text: Which  constellation contains many bright shining stars, such as Regulus. Leo.

A8.text: Orion's two brightest stars are Rigel and Betelgeuse

A9.text: Scorpius contains many bright stars, including Antares (Î± Sco), 'rival of Mars,' so named because of its distinct reddish hue

A10.text: This means that at its brightest it is the second brightest star in Scorpius.
